title.narrative: SWE-2010-93 Practical Adaptation: Fishers Traditional Responses to Impacts of Climate Variability on Water and Land-based Resources in the Lake Victor
SWE-2010-93 Practical Adaptation: Fishers Traditional Responses to Impacts of Climate Variability on Water and Land-based Resources in the Lake Victor

description.narrative: The study explores fishers traditional coping mechanisms to climate variability in Lake Victoria and how these mechanisms have been changing and adapting through generations. Focus is on understanding the impact of the current extreme weather patterns on these mechanisms, the fishers response, and the implications for livelihood and resource use. Attention is paid to gender relations at household and community level. The study draws on vulnerability and resilience studies and employs various methods such as household survey interviews, participatory methods, and observation. The study will present an in-depth understanding of the dynamics of fishers traditional coping mechanisms and propose suggestions as to how this understanding could be used as a basis for developing alternative coping strategies to future climate changes in the basin.

Attention is paid to gender relations at household and community level. The study draws on vulnerability and resilience studies and employs various methods such as household survey interviews, participatory methods, and observation. The study will present an in-depth understanding of the dynamics of fishers traditional coping mechanisms and propose suggestions as to how this understanding could be used as a basis for developing alternative coping strategies to future climate changes in the basin.
